text: [2.5] [4 points] In the pooled data model, you can compute the logarithm of the marginal likelihood of the hyper-parameters given the data as betaln(a + ni, b + n0) - betaln(a, b) (which is the ratio of posterior and prior normalizing constants, converted to the log domain; betaln is from scipy.special). Here, n1 is the mumber of 1s, n0 is the number of 05, a gives the value of a, and b gives the value of 5. Can you find the value of @ and ยง that optimize the marginal likelihood? (What are they, and what's the fikelihood?)
